item.title: Chartres - Wikipedia
item.description: Chartres is best known for its cathedral, the Cath√©drale Notre-Dame de Chartres, which is considered one of the finest and best preserved Gothic cathedrals in France and in Europe. Its historical and cultural importance has been recognized by its inclusion on the UNESCO list of World Heritage Sites.

item.title: Chartres | France, Map, History, & Facts | Britannica
item.description: Chartres, town, capital of Eure-et-Loir d√©partement, Centre r√©gion, northwestern France, southwest of Paris. The town is built on the left bank of the Eure River, and the spires of its famous cathedral are a landmark on the plain of Beauce.

item.title: 25 Best & Fun Things to Do in Chartres - The Tourist Checklist
item.description: Chartres, a charming town in France, is known for its stunning cathedral and beautiful countryside. This historic place is rich in culture, art, and natural beauty. Whether you are wandering through its narrow streets or enjoying the scenery by the river, Chartres offers something for everyone.

item.title: Chartres Travel Guide Resources & Trip Planning Info by Rick Steves
item.description: Chartres, about 50 miles southwest of Paris, gives travelers a pleasant break in a lively, midsize town with a thriving, pedestrian-friendly old center. But the big reason to come to Chartres is to see its famous cathedral ‚Äî arguably Europe's best example of pure Gothic architecture.
